Key Match Events: Giannis Antetokounmpo shook off a four-point first half and finished with 30 points and 12 rebounds as the Milwaukee Bucks rallied from a 19-point deficit and beat the Indiana Pacers 120-112 on Tuesday.
Post-Match Reflections: Giannis Antetokounmpo expressed his satisfaction with the team's comeback, stating, 'We didn't panic, we kept fighting, and that's what champions do.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the third meeting between the two teams in the 2024-2025 season, with the Milwaukee Bucks leading the series 2-0.
Others: The game was played at Gainbridge Fieldhouse in Indianapolis, Indiana, with an attendance of 17,274.
